problems.title: Maximum Product of Word Lengths (Bit Manipulation)
problems.description:
Problem Statement

Given a string array words, return the maximum value of length(word[i]) * length(word[j]) where the two words do not share common letters. If no such two words exist, return 0.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
abcw baz foo bar xtfn abcdef

Sample Output
16

Explanation: The two words can be "abcw", "xtfn".

Sample Input
a ab abc d cd bcd abcd

Sample Output
4

Explanation: The two words can be "ab", "cd".

Sample Input
a aa aaa aaaa

Sample Output
0

Explanation: No such pair of words.
problems.constraints:
2 <= words.length <= 1000
1 <= words[i].length <= 1000
words[i] consists only of lowercase English letters.

testCases.input: a ab abc d cd bcd abcd
abcw baz foo bar xtfn abcdef

hintsList: Use bit manipulation to represent each word's character set as a bitmask.
Two words don't share common letters if their bitmasks have no common set bits (bitwise AND is 0).
